page.title: 05SANDALL BEAT (cont'd)
page.content: {FLORA AND FAUNA:}In Sandall Beat wood there used to be badgers and nightgales.Now there are willow warblers,ring necked plovers,three types of woodpecker,the greater and lesser spotted and the green woodpecker.Kingfishers and whitethroats,foxes,weasels,stoats, hedgehogs, water and small voles and brown rats. {PIT HEAP ECOLOGY:}Gradually that part of the Beat which is used for spoil dumping by the pit is being colonised by various types of low plant life,some of which find competition easier in this situation. Among these plants are the rosebays and the mugwort.One tree,the birch,is also colonising the heap strongly.This is so exuberant that it has to be controlled by pit and council operations.
